attributes.action: Increase armed forces budget
attributes.background: We believe that the armed forces are receiving too little in budget and pay. and we believe that they should get more money due to the fact that everyday their life is put on the line.

attributes.action: All EU powers should return to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit
attributes.background: The UK government is saying that they need to reserve some powers after Brexit to protect the UK single market.  But that’s not necessarily true.  What they’re proposing would actually damage the UK and the UK single market.  So I call on the UK to automatically devolve all of these EU powers.
attributes.additional_details: Devolving all these powers would might prevent the break up of the UK.  Whereas, what the UK government is proposing would actually break Britain up.  So I would like to see a cross-party discussion on this.

attributes.action: Let contraceptives be sold over-the-counter
attributes.background: Contraceptives are currently not sold over-the-counter, you have to get a prescription for one. I believe that this should change. Many people require contraceptive pills and other forms of contraception for different reasons, and they have to go through too much hassle. Make pills over the counter!
attributes.additional_details: People need contraceptives. Women and men - regardless of sexuality - need them to stop STIs and unplanned pregnancies. Transgender men who aren't on HRT can use them to stop their periods, and they may have a judgmental family who would treat them harshly if they found out this was why they were getting contraception - especially 13-to-16-year-olds. Making contraceptives over-the-counter will benefit so many people in terms of health and confidentiality, so what are we waiting for?

attributes.action: Legally binding target to give men and women equal life expectancy.
attributes.background: End the worst gender inequality of them all - refocus health resources to give men and women equal life expectancy. The ONS states that the average life expectancy is 79 years for men and 83 years for women. This is a shocking discrimination against men, in the most fundamental way - life itself.
attributes.additional_details: The government should re-direct NHS resources to close the 4-year gap. No child should be born to a shorter life simply by being born male. Medical opinion is that there is no basic reason why women should live longer than men - so resources in research, treatment, health education etc. should be focused on men's health until the gap is closed.

attributes.action: Stop asking schools to check the right to work for parents on school visits
attributes.background: Parents accompanying off site visits with schools are classed as volunteers. All workers voluntary or otherwise must have their right to work checked. This requirement for checks involves schools taking a copy of a passport and signing and dating to say it represents the parent.
attributes.additional_details: I am Headteacher in a busy primary school and neither I nor my office staff have time for unnecessary work. This requirement to check adds an additional admin burden for people who in goodwill are supporting the work of the school on a casual and irregular basis. Accompanying off site visits does not constitute work and will not lead to employment. Parents of children who attend a state funded school must have the right to work and residence or their children will not get a place in school.

attributes.action: Make snow days a compulsory paid day off
attributes.background: We are asking the government to make snow days a compulsory paid day off we ask that under a amber warning for snow that if you cannot get into work or the company that you work for does not trade that we are paid for it

attributes.action: Debate the protection of vulnerable people from excessive insurance renewals
attributes.background:
The government needs to protect elderly and vulnerable people who are unable to look for and change to more competitive deals with alternative insurance providers for home insurance.

Which may result in the elderly person and property not being insured as the excessive cost is prohibitive
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of a number of elderly persons receiving excessive home insurance renewal premiums which were five times market rate. This is due to the insurance company's understanding that the elderly could be without internet access or otherwise isolated and would find it difficult or indeed impossible to move to cheaper alternative providers - and therefore incumbent insurance companies inflate renewals and any subsequent offers as there is no independent oversight available.

attributes.action: Ban nudity on social media
attributes.background: Nudity has a negative affect on society, and vulnerable individuals are pressured into posting provocative images online which will stay there forever. Naked pictures online causes harm to future generations, because children may feel ‘not good enough’ when compared to the images online.
attributes.additional_details: Instagram and YouTube are full of inappropriate material that shouldn’t be uploaded in the first place.

attributes.action: Teach young adults the struggles of owning a house.
attributes.background: I would like for schools and colleges ect, to teach young adults how hard it is to run a property of their own so when it comes to them having their own property rented, bought or shared accommodation they will know what to do when they come to the hurdles without it ending in them becoming homeless
attributes.additional_details: I strongly agree something like this should be taught budgeting, mortgages. Too many people going into the world with no life skills.

attributes.action: HMG to advise Her Majesty to remove “Royal” from Borough of Kensington & Chelsea
attributes.background: On the Prime Minister’s advice, Wootton Basset was awarded the title “Royal” as a result of it's dedicated action. If this honour can be awarded it can also be removed. This should apply to Kensington and Chelsea as a result of the action prior to and inaction following the Grenfell Tower tragedy.
attributes.additional_details: It is an affront to British values for Kensington and Chelsea to continue to use the title “Royal”. The council leader has resigned. Responsibility for Grenfell Tower residents has been taken away from the council by HM Government. A public inquiry has been ordered by HM Government.

attributes.action: Legally enforce an opt-out solution for paper publications sent by organisations
attributes.background: Universities, schools, and professional bodies frequently post paper journals and other publications to their members. These are usually unsolicited, and often thrown away unread. In the era of online technology, they are a waste of public and private money, and needlessly damage the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It would be very simple to create a central website (one could be built at very little expense), to which these large organisations must have a log in.  Individuals could then record their wish to unsubscribe from monthly paper publications (by organisation): expressing their mailing frequency preference, or requesting online issues instead.  The government should compel these organisations to have a membership to this system, and to respect the preferences of those receiving these publications.

attributes.action: Start a Parliamentary debate over funding of the UK's crumbling road network
attributes.background: The UK is the 9th richest country in the world by GDP however a recent survey of the standard of its road network placed it 27th behind such countries as Namibia and Ecuador. The problems represent chronic under investment in crucial infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details:
Studies have shown patching up roads to be 10 times more expensive in the long run than resurfacing entire stretches.

Please sign this petition if you too have had enough and think it is time the funding of road maintenance was subject to a serious debate in Parliament in attempt to bring the road network of the UK to a standard where it is actually fit for purpose rather than the national embarrassment, safety hazard to road users and barrier to economic growth that it currently is.

attributes.action: Make the sale of Cannabis Seeds Illegal in the UK
attributes.background: It may surprise you that while it is illegal to have anything to do with Cannabis,it is fine to sell Cannabis Seeds.This may seem to you to be"Asking for trouble"and"Clearly stupid, contradictory & sending a mixed message".This is a loophole that allows cultivation to Start and allows gangs to form.
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis causes mental illness and disrupts educational progression. If as a Society we are opposed to it, we should be opposed to it all the way and not leave loopholes open so that "Head Shops" can sell cannabis seeds under the ludicrous pretext that they are doing it for sentimental reasons or for "genetic storage". This is a barefaced lie that puts the health of the Nation at risk.

attributes.action: Full-time employees to receive £100 bonus a month if they have no sickness
attributes.background: People who work full time, pay bills, have no help and have little left per month should be rewarded with a £100 incentive. This would make people working full time feel appreciated. The Government are helping the wrong people and its time for full-time workers to have a reward.

attributes.action: No transfer of powers to councils to fine motorists for minor traffic offences
attributes.background: Town halls want to rake in more cash by securing sweeping new powers to impose fines on motorists for minor traffic offences.  The Local Government Association want government to transfer powers to them that are currently only available to the police.
attributes.additional_details: The Local Government Association have already started the process of lobbying government in the form of the Department of Transport.  They believe that they are better suited to this enforcement than the police.  This has already been rejected once, but they are continuing to put pressure on government for the change.  We already know that local government isn't about making things safer it's purely a revenue raising exercise and again the motorist is yet again being seen as a cash cow.

attributes.action: Redirect funds gained from taxing 'Legal Highs' to Safe Housing & Rehab Centres
attributes.background:
Formally Legal highs started out as a legal recreational drug, found in many shops in the UK and often seen in use in festivals. 
Fast forward 10 years and the now illegal  psychoactive substances leave addicts with side effects, paranoia, coma, seizures and death with no specialised support.
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the new legislation ( The Psychoactive Substances Act May 2016)  ' legal high' was the title given to  substances sold that emulated illegal drugs such as cocaine,heroin, speed, cannabis. It could be found sold in shops/festivals/online. Since the Ban was enforced these psychoactive drugs have been forced underground and are now even more dangerous. I suggest that any taxes gathered from the years that the drug was 'legal ' should be redirected in specific rehab and homeless centres.

attributes.action: alter law so that biological parents are legal guardian of their surrogate child
attributes.background: In the UK, the worrying thing about using your own embryo (which is biologically yours and your partners DNA) is that the surrogate is the legal guardian and can keep the child once born, if they decide to. I find this a scary thought after struggling to have my own child and considering surrogacy.
attributes.additional_details: If the embryo is biologically from the couple struggling with fertility and they choose to use a surrogate, there should be a law in place to say that baby is theirs legally and that the surrogate cannot keep the child once born. Couples struggling with infertility have enough to worry about without having their hopes dashed by a surrogate mother who may suddenly decide she doesn't want to part with the child once born, which would be devastating if the couple are biologically the 'real' parents

attributes.action: Make teaching sexual abuse/assualt in more detail part of the curriculum
attributes.background: Many people (adults and children alike) who have been abused often say that they didn't realise what was happening was actually abuse for a very long time.  By educating children about what is abuse will empower them to protect themselves.  Abusers rely ignorance and secrecy.
attributes.additional_details: By talking about abuse of any kind openly and freely we take away the secrecy and make it less of a taboo subject and people may, hopefully, 1. be more aware of how to protect themselves, 2. feel more able to speak up if something does happen to them, 3. make abusers more wary of abusing.

attributes.action: Require ride-sharing services to give drivers equity to operate in the UK
attributes.background: To get a license to operate in the UK, all "gig economy" types of companies such as Uber, Gett, Deliveroo, etc. would be required to designate a pool of equity (or cash from its sale) to its workers. This would be distributed on a negotiated per mile/hour basis + a 'time on network' + rating policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect Intelligent Systems Workers

Any worker who contributes to an intelligent network, AI or algorithm that will put their long-term work at risk should participate in the long-term equity success of that network or system because they are helping to build it.

The government should make this equity grant a requirement of entry into any city or town and should hold in escrow either equity, funds or both to protect the longterm future of these intelligent systems workers. 

www.found.ee/taxi

attributes.action: Install a fence or screen in the middle of motorways to prevent rubber necking
attributes.background: Rubber necking creates massive amounts of traffic even on a road that is totally unaffected. For example, an accident on the opposite carriage can cause a queue or a crash due to people looking across the road instead of where they're going. We need to install screens or barriers to prevent this!

attributes.action: Equal rights for boys up to their 18th birthday to receive the HPV vaccine.
attributes.background: Today 24/7/18, the government announced that boys aged 12-13 will receive the HPV vaccine from 2019. While this is great news,   I would like to petition the government to increase the age limit to the same that is offered to girls, up to their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
A jab that protects against a virus that causes cervical cancer will be given to boys aged 12 to 13 in England. 
The policy decision brings England into line with Scotland and Wales. 
HPV vaccine is already routinely offered to girls of the same age at secondary school and is free up until they turn 18.
Experts and campaigners have been calling for equal access to the jab, which can also guard against oral, throat and anal cancers.

attributes.action: Introduce law to fine or prosecute the parents of bullies
attributes.background: Bullies have always been a problem in all schools. No action takes place because of their age, therefore they continue to bully. Parents are threatened with fines or prosecution for their child to take too much time off school, surely parents should face the same threat for their child to bully.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullying, bullying, threats and ABH, suicide, low self esteem. If parents get fined or threatened with prosecution each time their child bullies another, bullying will become easier to deal with. No child wants their parents to be in trouble, I think this will make the parents more inclined to help stop their child’s bullying behaviour or get help with antibullying classes. Justice for the victims of school bullying. No child deserves to be hurt physically or mentally by their peers.

attributes.action: All foods that contain gelatine must state what type of animal it is made from
attributes.background: I would like this to happen as many religions have certain foods that they are not allowed to eat.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading the ingredients on the back of food to check and it just says gelatine is not helpful. This petition is simple and wants companies to be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products.

I really hope we can do this as a United Kingdom and bring together at least 10,000 signatures so we can get a written response from the Government!

attributes.action: Lower the tax on alcohol sold in pubs and clubs
attributes.background: Once the local pub or club was the centre of a community, people met their future spouses, discussed their problems and received help, made friends and built a network of support encouraging a communal spirit and mental well-being. Cheap alcohol consumption from an off licence fosters non of this.
attributes.additional_details: There is a rising level of mental health issues / youth disorders I believe can be linked to the lose of community spirit. Clubs and pubs can form a focal point of this along side health and fitness centers, recreational clubs and community centers.  The tax on alcohol should be lowered in pubs / clubs to encourage people to get out and socialize rather than consume alcohol at home from off licence premises.

attributes.action: Have a Nicola Sturgeon statue in Westminster
attributes.background: I would like a Nicola Sturgeon statue built in the House of Commons.

attributes.action: Use the money paid at hospital parkings for the NHS
attributes.background: Hospital parking is so expensive but the public would not begrudge paying it if they knew it would benefit the NHS

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to feed and encourage seagulls to nest
attributes.background: The spiralling number of seagulls in our cities and surrounding suburbs are adversely impacting the mental well-being of residents. Their incessant screeching starts in earnest in the early hours and persists for much of the day. They defecate on property, vehicles and washing and attract vermin
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/weird-news/residents-declare-war-seagulls-poisoned-6098194
http://www.worcesternews.co.uk/news/13581245.New_crackdown_drawn_up_to_tackle__aggressive__seagulls_in_Worcester/
https://www.economist.com/britain/2017/02/09/britains-war-on-seagulls
https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/26682
https://www.theedinburghreporter.co.uk/2017/02/morningside-councillor-wants-council-to-get-rid-of-gulls/

attributes.action: Ban the use of fireworks unless it’s a controlled and / or organised event
attributes.background: Fireworks are great but can cause unnecessary harm to both humans and animals. Fireworks are being used all year round although amazing they should be used at controlled events. Pets are often very frightened by them. A local pet slipped his lead recently and sadly passed away due to being run over
attributes.additional_details: If you know there is going to be a display you can be prepared for this but people are randomly setting fireworks off at all times of the year.   This has to stop. Also the elderly are often very anxious when hearing the loud banging and people  with dementia too.   Shops should get on board too with when they are to be sold. A government ruling needs to be actioned. The public could still be able to purchase but a ruling to say that only for Events, Firework Night and New Year etc.

attributes.action: Tax financial institutions to pay for social care, instead of personal taxation.
attributes.background:
Banks caused the global financial meltdown and took billions in bailouts from taxpayers. I think they’d should pay this back via a social care levy.
It would also help to restore public confidence in the banks.

attributes.action: Ban Smart Meters
attributes.background: There have been concerns about their effect on people’s health, along with the way that they could invade your privacy, and in the end they cost way more compared to an old type of meter.

attributes.action: Prevent requesting ID for energy drinks
attributes.background:
Due to recent media pressure, stores are now asking for ID for energy drinks. Energy drinks are a legal product, and most stores don't have the manpower or staffing availability to quickly serve their customers.
This behaviour should be stopped, driven as it is by a vocal segment of the population.

attributes.action: Hold a general election within the next 2 years
attributes.background: We are in the middle of the Brexit process and the government has made no progress at all so far, when we’re about to leave the EU in March next year.  This literally shows that this government is too weak to govern the country and to come to an agreement on terms.
attributes.additional_details: Also, some council elections will be in May 2022, which means the General Election will clash with the council elections and we’re supposed to have one election within this five year timeframe, not more than one.

attributes.action: Stop long distance live animal transport for fattening or slaughter to/from UK.
attributes.background: This topic has been petitioned before and finished in March 2018.  I would like the topic to be kept in the public eye and to remind the appropriate government departments (Trade and industry / Farming and Agriculture) do not let this important issue to slip through the net.

attributes.action: Abolish International Student Fees and Finance Ineligibility for UK Citizens
attributes.background: The prerequisite three year residence in the UK deprives British citizens from the ability to access Student Finance, meaning that families have to attempt to pay the massive fees on their own. This disadvantages domestic students, and is unfair on those who possess British passports and citizenship
attributes.additional_details: I moved back to the UK from overseas in June 2017, and wish to apply for university in 2019, once I have completed A Levels. I was born in Kings-Lynn, Norfolk, and have possessed a British passport all my life. Having never lived under another nationality, or been a permanent resident of any foreign country, to find out that I am classed as an international student within my own borders is upsetting, and is a disadvantage for me, as I now cannot afford higher education, or find myself a job.

attributes.action: Abolish the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991
attributes.background: Thousands of unwanted dogs (primarily Pitbulls) are put down because of the Dangerous Dogs Act which makes it illegal for breeds which are classified as 'dangerous' to be rehomed to a loving owner and have to be euthanized if they become unwanted by their original owner.

attributes.action: Public transport(bus) to have cabin filters to protect passengers and drivers
attributes.background: high pollution is danger for all of us, the cabin filter will protect and save lives
attributes.additional_details: it was a few documentary on tv shown that danger (heavy) car emission are cumulated in public transport like tram and buses. The ventilate is not an option, a proper pollen filter will make a different and it will save some lives, and help

attributes.action: Raise the stamp duty on second homes and onwards to 50% to fund home building.
attributes.background: House prices are too high for first time buyers. Funds raised by stamp duty on second homes can be used to build new affordable homes.

attributes.action: Make GCSE English Literature open book and give all formulae for other exams.
attributes.background: Exam boards say that the new 9-1 GCSE exams are 'not a memory test' but rather 'an assessment of skill'. However, students are not given formulae and studied literature texts in exams, thus making them memory tests. This puts unnecessary pressure on students, and leads to deteriorated mental health.

attributes.action: Fine people who call 999 or show up to A&E without life threatening problems.
attributes.background: One in three calls are emergency and life threatening injuries. Two out of three are not. We can prevent wasting £8.50 on those who call 999 or show up to A&E wasting the healthcare’s time when they have other services they can utilise. Fining a person can help to deter these time wasting problems.
attributes.additional_details: 1. https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/society/2015/dec/25/frequent-999-callers-nhs-england-ambulance-emergency

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave a Statutory Right With Reasonable Period off & full pay
attributes.background: compassionate leave is not offered in my contract, I researched this online and found that this is not a statutory right. If like me you work on commission and earn a low salary you will struggle financially in an emergency, I think this needs to change and people should have the right to grieve.
attributes.additional_details:
My wife's grandmother died and we had to fly to get to the funeral, upon my return I was told that I would need to use my 5 of my holiday days (I only get 20) as they didn't offer compassionate leave. I thought this was unfair and I feel that this needs to change and should be a basic right. 

gov.uk website 
"pay, your employer may pay you for time off to look after dependents but they don't have to. check your contact, company handbook or internet site to see if there are rules about this. "

attributes.action: UK Government to create a scheme to help people to manage their gambling.
attributes.background: Gambling was legalised in 1961 for better government control and to allow SMALL bets to be placed. There are 450k-2million problem gamblers that effect 2-10million people in the UK. Can i suggest that the UK government considers the introduction of a 'gambling card' that will control gambling.
attributes.additional_details: I believe there is a 'conflict of interest' letting betting companies deal with 'Self exclusion' and 'Affordability checks'. Betting companies do not identify problem gamblers and there is no instructions how they could identify problem gamblers. Amounts placed and frequency is not monitored. Could the government, working with betting firms, consider a 'gambling card' be introduced based on someone's income. Gambling is not FUN if someone can lose more than they can afford to.

attributes.action: UK residents aged 16 and 17 year olds should be able to vote in referendums.
attributes.background: I think that people in the UK who were 16/17 should be able to vote in referendums. An example of this I think that 16/17 should have been able to vote in the EU referendum and weren't allowed to and leaving the EU will affect those who weren't able to vote in it, me being one of those individuals.

attributes.action: Allegations of workplace bullying against John Bercow should be investigated.
attributes.background: John Bercow, the Speaker of the House of Commons, has been accused of workplace bullying. MPs have rejected the proposal of an investigation into these claims.  The accusations against the Speaker need to be investigated. Those elected to the House of Commons must be accountable for their behaviour.

attributes.action: Offer all GCSE, A level and University students a mental health check
attributes.background: Lots of young adults have mental health issues and don't speak out about it and are scared to. To stop this from developing all students should have a mental health check yearly between years 10 to finishing university. This can then get all students the help that they deserve and should have.
attributes.additional_details: School is hard enough to get through and deal with during these stressful times without having disorders and everything holding you down. This can become easier through knowing who has these issues and helping them through the process.

attributes.action: Improve school lunch standards to ensure all children eat lunch
attributes.background: I have raised concern over many school children not eating lunch during school. This is due to unappetizing and unhygienic meals which put's the school children off of their food. This is a major concern because the school children are missing out on vital nutrients required to grow.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do the children find the food disgusting and extremely unappetizing, both teachers and parents have also commented on the situation and are worried about the health of students from leaving out such vital nutrients. Without a sustainable amount of energy, school children will be unable to concentrate during lessons which may affect their education.

attributes.action: Urge the Commonwealth to suspend Pakistan’s membership.
attributes.background: The former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, has not been given a fair trial by the Supreme Court of Pakistan. His life and political career may be in danger.
attributes.additional_details:
The Supreme Court of Pakistan has taken away the right from Nawaz Sharif to contest the next general elections in Pakistan. He has also been disqualified from Prime Ministership. Nawaz Sharif is a target of the Pakistan Army and Supreme Court of Pakistan. 
 
The UK Government should urge the Commonwealth Ministerial Action Group to suspend Pakistan’s Commonwealth membership, until they give fair trial and right to contest election to Nawaz Sharif.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for prisoners to share a cell.
attributes.background:
Prison is a very stressful and violent environment. People are placed there to be so called "reabilitated'.
In order for a prisoner to progress, inmates should not have to endure the added suffering that is to share a cell.
How would you feel if you had to go to the toilet in front of a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand prison is place for people who broke the law but prison nowadays are full of people suffering from mental health issues who should not be there in the first place.
Prisons are the new "Asylums" and inmates suffering from mental health issues are particularly vulnerable in a cell sharing scenario.
Prison is about the loss of freedom, not suffering further torture while inside one.

attributes.action: A fresh look at Hi-tech solutions to reduce traffic congestion nationwide.
attributes.background:
Using roads sensibly will save most people money and will help save lives; according to the BBC article 1 in 6 deaths worldwide are due to pollution. 
We want the government to look at solutions available today that can dramatically reduce congestion, such as a smart phone app for car sharing.
attributes.additional_details:
Using a Car share app on a phone provides high levels of safety and an alternate lift home if necessary. 

The government is obliged to improve air quality.  http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38990192
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-41678533

Using DfT report from 2005, an example an average car travelling 20 miles each day with 3 occupants, will save £1,000 per occupant per year.  
http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http:/www.dft.gov.uk/pgr/sustainable/cars/makingcarsharingmarch2005.pdf

attributes.action: Provide mental health training to all teachers
attributes.background: Specialised mental health training for teachers will help them to identify children with mental health issues and get them the help they need. I want an end to the stigma.

attributes.action: Debt agencies should only charge a small percentage fee for recovery of any debt
attributes.background: Companies and debt agencies should only be allowed to charge a very small percentage fee for any recovery of debts.
attributes.additional_details: Debt is a nationwide epidemic, companies and debt agencies have been exploiting people’s financial difficulties, and charging excessive amounts of money to recover any debt, often pushing people into further debt, and even bankruptcies and/or debt relief orders. Writing people off financially for years and sometimes preventing them from ever getting back on there financial feet again. Debt is a very stressful, experience causing anxiety, depression and even suicides. It’s time to change the la !
